[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 06:58:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_vmware_volumeops.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/volumeops.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_vmware_vmdk.py'], 'message': 'VMware:Persist storage policy ID in vmdk meta-data

The VMDK driver allows the OpenStack admin to specify the storage
tier (vCenter datastore) of a volume (vmdk) using a storage policy
set in the volume type. Currently we use the storage policy only
to determine a datastore where the volume is placed. Some storage
policies, for e.g. those corresponding to vvol and vsan datastores
allow specifying array specific capabilities such as replication.
In order for these capabilities to be applied to the volume, we
should persist the storage policy ID in the vmdk meta-data in
vCenter. This patch fixes this problem by persisting the storage
policy ID in the vmdk meta-data.

Closes-bug: #1593590
Change-Id: I247bf2a072e195c3918f222a9770f8018690db16
'}]
commit_message:
VMware:Persist storage policy ID in vmdk meta-data

The VMDK driver allows the OpenStack admin to specify the storage
tier (vCenter datastore) of a volume (vmdk) using a storage policy
set in the volume type. Currently we use the storage policy only
to determine a datastore where the volume is placed. Some storage
policies, for e.g. those corresponding to vvol and vsan datastores
allow specifying array specific capabilities such as replication.
In order for these capabilities to be applied to the volume, we
should persist the storage policy ID in the vmdk meta-data in
vCenter. This patch fixes this problem by persisting the storage
policy ID in the vmdk meta-data.

Closes-bug: #1593590
Change-Id: I247bf2a072e195c3918f222a9770f8018690db16

commit_message:
Revert "Compact Kilo database migrations"

Some differences discovered in resulting schema. Reverting now until all changes can be identified and corrected.

This reverts commit 10bce4b764976875cb7b3eed59b5149ba1ea070f.

Related-Bug: #1593175
Change-Id: Ib28f85ecae5f6388de41d5d249e7dd7ad2f72bc6

commit_message:
Undercloud install is not a script anymore

I could swear we fixed this a long time ago, but apparently not.
The undercloud install is now started via an OSC command, so the
user is not running a script anymore.

commit_message:
Upgrade pip only if PIP_UPGRADE=true

There is a issue in pip 1.8.2 [1] that causes a failure[2] if
LIBS_FROM_GIT= is defined in local.conf

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/3764
[2] http://13.69.151.247/86/329586/4/check-cinder/Cinder-ISER-LIO/92e5968/env/pip-freeze.txt.gz

Change-Id: I69365c6ec180c84e4acb6922d195281abc00972b

commit_message:
Return ResponseBody object from delete_role

All service client methods shouyld return the ResponseBody object
instead of individual resp & body tuple.

This method was missed and caught by new unit tests of roles_client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 04:24:00.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/admin/v2/test_tokens.py', 'tempest/cmd/cleanup.py', 'tempest/cmd/javelin.py', 'tempest/common/cred_client.py', 'tempest/api/identity/admin/v2/test_users.py', 'tempest/api/identity/admin/v2/test_roles.py', 'tempest/services/identity/v2/json/roles_client.py', 'tempest/api/identity/admin/v2/test_roles_negative.py', 'tempest/tests/common/test_dynamic_creds.py'], 'message': 'Make identity v2 roles_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes identity v2 roles_client use **kwargs.

Also rename some method to match the consistency and later those
can match with v3 clients methods naming and we can remove many wrapper
method exist currently to call v2 and v3 methods.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I88153db1649ef890786b1354180e528fb3f3dc25
'}]
commit_message:
Make identity v2 roles_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes identity v2 roles_client use **kwargs.

Also rename some method to match the consistency and later those
can match with v3 clients methods naming and we can remove many wrapper
method exist currently to call v2 and v3 methods.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I88153db1649ef890786b1354180e528fb3f3dc25

subject: Allow updating of nodes in baremetal import
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8532, 'name': 'Ryan Brady', 'email': 'rbrady@redhat.com', 'username': 'rbrady'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11105, 'name': 'Swapnil Kulkarni', 'email': 'coolsvap@gmail.com', 'username': 'coolsvap'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 17:23:14.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/utils/test_nodes.py', 'tripleo_common/utils/nodes.py'], 'message': "Allow updating of nodes in baremetal import

Right now, if you attempt to update a node's details using the
baremetal import command and the node has both a mac and a pm_addr
specified, it will fail because _get_node_id finds both the mac
and pm_addr match and adds the id to a list twice.  Since it's
perfectly fine for a node to match both of those fields, we
shouldn't error in that case.  Using a set instead of a list for
the data structure makes this work as expected.

Change-Id: I4b9fb1531c59a090b67f19d673c21c22b4f9523b
Closes-Bug: 1586523
(cherry picked from commit 7bd80dbdf22f0693e357d9a81ee6308ad53a7a1e)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow updating of nodes in baremetal import

Right now, if you attempt to update a node's details using the
baremetal import command and the node has both a mac and a pm_addr
specified, it will fail because _get_node_id finds both the mac
and pm_addr match and adds the id to a list twice.  Since it's
perfectly fine for a node to match both of those fields, we
shouldn't error in that case.  Using a set instead of a list for
the data structure makes this work as expected.

Change-Id: I4b9fb1531c59a090b67f19d673c21c22b4f9523b
Closes-Bug: 1586523
(cherry picked from commit 7bd80dbdf22f0693e357d9a81ee6308ad53a7a1e)

Fix show_checkpoint

show_checkpoint now returns a dictionary representing the checkpoint,
instead of the python checkpoint object (which lead to error on
show_checkpoint)

commit_message:
Add RegisterNodesAction action

This patch adds a custom wrapper around the tripleo-common
utils/nodes.py register_all_nodes function so that we can
call it in a workflow to help register nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Brady <rbrady@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dougal Matthews <dougal@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibd5b2f12b453b70c54272e43ae31195895bd4a20
Depends-On: I17116c0f995ab76ed79bd8b2df57629c1ed4e4d0

subject: Address Ansible bare variable usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 13:49:19.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lockdown.yml'], 'message': 'Address Ansible bare variable usage

When executing the role with Ansible 2.1, the following
deprecation warning is issued in the output for some tasks.

Change-Id: I67e2a443dbad839bb38af88d9a0897943ded0a4d

commit_message:
Address Ansible bare variable usage

When executing the role with Ansible 2.1, the following
deprecation warning is issued in the output for some tasks.

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using bare variables is deprecated.

This patch addresses the tasks to fix the behaviour appropriately.

Change-Id: I67e2a443dbad839bb38af88d9a0897943ded0a4d

commit_message:
handle SSL connection in l2gateway agent

ovsdb server will initiate SSL connection to l2gateway agent, whenever
ovsdb manager table is populated with l2gateway agent IP with SSL.
This patch set will handle the ssl connection in the l2gw agent side.

Change-Id: Ie333ab4ef647e033cd8bf5d2c3245e4532f3267e
Closes-Bug: 1585901

subject: Enabled Neutron notifications in sample local.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 19:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf'], 'message': "Enabled Neutron notifications in sample local.conf

For a period of time, neutron seemed to send notifications by default.
That period of time seems to have passed and notifications are not longer
on by default when you stack. At least that's what I observed on today's
devstack.  Whatever the case, it seems we might as well explicitly enable
them.

Change-Id: Ica4f526305e0a984c0d9bb689f50da42406dcf82
"}]
commit_message:
Enabled Neutron notifications in sample local.conf

For a period of time, neutron seemed to send notifications by default.
That period of time seems to have passed and notifications are not longer
on by default when you stack. At least that's what I observed on today's
devstack.  Whatever the case, it seems we might as well explicitly enable
them.

Change-Id: Ica4f526305e0a984c0d9bb689f50da42406dcf82

subject: Enable firewall by default on the overcloud
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-20 18:03:16.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable firewall by default on the overcloud

We firewall the undercloud, which is only listening on the
provisioning network anyway, but our default settings leave the
overcloud, which needs to be publicly accessible (for a
deployment-specific definition of "public"), wide open.  This
seems like a bad default.

Anyone who is deploying additional services can either open the
firewall ports themselves as part of the deployment or can set the
ManageFirewall param to false.

Change-Id: I3731a0a7bc4be94c8e7a289c90d304599634e928
'}]
commit_message:
Enable firewall by default on the overcloud

We firewall the undercloud, which is only listening on the
provisioning network anyway, but our default settings leave the
overcloud, which needs to be publicly accessible (for a
deployment-specific definition of "public"), wide open.  This
seems like a bad default.

Anyone who is deploying additional services can either open the
firewall ports themselves as part of the deployment or can set the
ManageFirewall param to false.

Change-Id: I3731a0a7bc4be94c8e7a289c90d304599634e928

Allow pacemaker ports in firewall

This is required to allow ha deployments with ManageFirewall: True
These are the ports documented in [1].

Closes-Bug: 1594470

commit_message:
Use template filter to convert list of packages in the template

Before this patch _data_table.html checked string
representation to check if the list is empty.

This patch adds jsonify filter and moves actual jsonification into
template, thus eliminating the need to compare string representation of
lists.

Change-Id: Iddf6ab7c8cff1d1dff98badbd117200e9d3b22e7
Closes-Bug: #1584802

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-06-10 17:45:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py'], 'message': "DVR: Fix allowed_address_pair port binding with delayed fip

Today when allowed_address_pairs are configured on a dvr
service port and if a floatingip is associated with the
allowed_address_pair port, we inherit the dvr service port's
host and the device_owner to which the port is associated.

But when the floatingip is created on the allowed_address_pair
port after the port is associated with a dvr service port, then
we apply the right port host binding and the arp_update.

This patch address the issue, by checking for the host binding
when there is a new floatingip configured. If host binding is
missing and if the port happens to be an allowed_address_pair
port, then it checks for the associated service port and if there
is a single valid and active service port, then it inherits the
host binding and device owner from the dvr service port and also
applies the right arp entry. If there is are more than one
active ports, then it returns.

Closes-Bug: #1569918
Change-Id: I80a299d3f99113f77d2e728c3d9e000d01dacebd
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Fix allowed_address_pair port binding with delayed fip

Today when allowed_address_pairs are configured on a dvr
service port and if a floatingip is associated with the
allowed_address_pair port, we inherit the dvr service port's
host and the device_owner to which the port is associated.

But when the floatingip is created on the allowed_address_pair
port after the port is associated with a dvr service port, then
we apply the right port host binding and the arp_update.

This patch address the issue, by checking for the host binding
when there is a new floatingip configured. If host binding is
missing and if the port happens to be an allowed_address_pair
port, then it checks for the associated service port and if there
is a single valid and active service port, then it inherits the
host binding and device owner from the dvr service port and also
applies the right arp entry. If there is are more than one
active ports, then it returns.

Closes-Bug: #1569918
Change-Id: I80a299d3f99113f77d2e728c3d9e000d01dacebd

commit_message:
Implement volume type basic operation

The purpose of this patch set is to provide the end users with
the following functionalities:
1. Create volume type resources, only admin is able to create volume type
2. Show details for a volume type by id
3. List volume types
4. Update a volume type, only admin is able to update volume type
5. Delete a volume type, only admin is able to delete volume type

Change-Id: I6e3188018eff6db155ec02dbd2af6aefc0363df9

commit_message:
handle SSL connection in l2gateway agent

ovsdb server will initiate SSL connection to l2gateway agent, whenever
ovsdb manager table is populated with l2gateway agent IP with SSL.
This patch set will handle the ssl connection in the l2gw agent side.

Change-Id: I63f1f0465fdcbdc9ed6be0d98fb8e5b59e882eb0
Closes-Bug: 1585901

commit_message:
Add customizations for apt keys and packages

To customize apt packages, you need to do something like that in
override file:

{% set base_apt_packages = base_apt_packages + ['vim', 'emacs'] %}

Change-Id: I7913ed405c2cb7e33f1cfe310d651030e0700e6b
Partially-implements: blueprint third-party-plugin-support

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 09:58:30.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/objects/volume_type.py', 'cinder/objects/base.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume_type.py', 'cinder/scheduler/filters/extra_specs_ops.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'cinder/scheduler/filters/capabilities_filter.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_filters.py'], 'message': "Support None value of extra_specs in cinder-scheduler filter

Now cinder backends hava capabilities of None value.
Cinder-api also allow user to set volume type's extra_specs to None
value. However we cann't use these capabilities in cinder scheduler
filter.
This change supports None value of extra_specs in cinder-scheduler
filter.

Further more, Our VolumeType object don't allow none value of
extra_specs and this causs failure when trying to create a
volume from such volume type. This commit also changes that
field type to DictOfNullableStringsField which allows it.

Also object backporting procedure is added to make sure that before
sending data to older services we're switching None to empty string.
(PS: if older service use functions like volume.refersh to read
None value of extra_spec from db itself, it will hit bug #1588798
anyway.)

Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>

Change-Id: I301adc5980dbacec5e84de7c66e6d12d132643cd
Closes-bug: #1588798
"}]
commit_message:
Support None value of extra_specs in cinder-scheduler filter

Now cinder backends hava capabilities of None value.
Cinder-api also allow user to set volume type's extra_specs to None
value. However we cann't use these capabilities in cinder scheduler
filter.
This change supports None value of extra_specs in cinder-scheduler
filter.

Further more, Our VolumeType object don't allow none value of
extra_specs and this causs failure when trying to create a
volume from such volume type. This commit also changes that
field type to DictOfNullableStringsField which allows it.

Also object backporting procedure is added to make sure that before
sending data to older services we're switching None to empty string.
(PS: if older service use functions like volume.refersh to read
None value of extra_spec from db itself, it will hit bug #1588798
anyway.)

Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>

Change-Id: I301adc5980dbacec5e84de7c66e6d12d132643cd
Closes-bug: #1588798

commit_message:
Add tqdm progress metering library

This will be quite handy for usage in kolla so that the
image building can output a progress bar (instead of
being mostly silent)

Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, last updated on 2016-05-30

Is the library good code?

Seems well written and commented.

Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes

Is the library license compatible?

Yes

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

Does not currently appear to be (but a google search
did show that there are deb packages and fedora packages
that may just not be in the normal repos).

Is the function of this library already covered by other
libraries in global-requirements.txt?

Not as far as I know.

Change-Id: Ib5e1542131524f66e2d5154956a23111902c2b19

subject: Fixed a bug when Heat Stack Update was called without template changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 17:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/system/heat_stack.py', 'murano/common/utils.py', 'murano/tests/unit/common/test_is_different.py', 'murano/dsl/helpers.py'], 'message': "Fixed a bug when Heat Stack Update was called without template changes

The 'is_different' utility function was relying on the sequence of
dictionary keys when determining whether the objects are different or
not, which is incorrect, since Python does not guarantee the order of
keys in regular dictionaries.

This was causing the function to report false inequalities after the
Heat Stack is pushed, thus causing murano to re-push the stack even if
it was not modified in between.

The calls of the 'is_different' method were replaced with simple
equality check which are guaranteed to return appropriate result. The
only known limitation of such approach is its inability to check for
circular references. However this is not the case for Murano-generate
Heat snippets, since all the variables in MuranoPL are immutable and
it's impossible to create a circular-referencing snippet with
MuranoPL. Thus it is safe to completely remove 'is_different' method
and all related code.

The same patch also introduces a simple check which verifies that the
HeatStack.update_template() method introduces an actual change into
the template, or does not cause a subsequent push() call otherwise.

Change-Id: Ia71b44ed62f39d9c89630c5a5c21b79c7c17ea9d
Closes-bug: #1594451
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed a bug when Heat Stack Update was called without template changes

The 'is_different' utility function was relying on the sequence of
dictionary keys when determining whether the objects are different or
not, which is incorrect, since Python does not guarantee the order of
keys in regular dictionaries.

This was causing the function to report false inequalities after the
Heat Stack is pushed, thus causing murano to re-push the stack even if
it was not modified in between.

The calls of the 'is_different' method were replaced with simple
equality check which are guaranteed to return appropriate result. The
only known limitation of such approach is its inability to check for
circular references. However this is not the case for Murano-generate
Heat snippets, since all the variables in MuranoPL are immutable and
it's impossible to create a circular-referencing snippet with
MuranoPL. Thus it is safe to completely remove 'is_different' method
and all related code.

The same patch also introduces a simple check which verifies that the
HeatStack.update_template() method introduces an actual change into
the template, or does not cause a subsequent push() call otherwise.

Change-Id: Ia71b44ed62f39d9c89630c5a5c21b79c7c17ea9d
Closes-bug: #1594451

commit_message:
Fix hz-dynamic-table formatting for magic-search and actions

Using https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309561/ as a guide, this patch
cleans up formatting for actions and the magic-search bar.  It:
 * Pads the action buttons a little; they are not part of a button-group.
 * Does not display the dangling empty facet list if there are no facets.
 * Aligns the batch actions to the right when placed inline with search.
 * Gives more room to the search bar

Change-Id: Iced01bb792ee36699e653bf3c332341bb097e80f
Closes-Bug: 1592834
Closes-Bug: 1592835

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 14:19:51.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_console_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_snmp.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_seamicro.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_iboot.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_base_vendor.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_ssh.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/test_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_ipminative.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_client.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_ipmitool.py'], 'message': "Replace dict.get(key) in drivers unit tests

This replaces dict.get(key) with dict[key] in
tests/unit/drivers & tests/unit/drivers/modules, since we should
be explicit about whether we expect the key to exist or not.

In particular, we shouldn't be doing
    self.assertIsNone(dict.get(key))
since it will pass if 1. the value is None or 2. the key isn't
in the dict.

Change-Id: I47388b2f8650f2110755129da63dc7f482a71bbf
Partial-Bug: #1590808
"}]
commit_message:
Replace dict.get(key) in drivers unit tests

This replaces dict.get(key) with dict[key] in
tests/unit/drivers & tests/unit/drivers/modules, since we should
be explicit about whether we expect the key to exist or not.

In particular, we shouldn't be doing
    self.assertIsNone(dict.get(key))
since it will pass if 1. the value is None or 2. the key isn't
in the dict.

Change-Id: I47388b2f8650f2110755129da63dc7f482a71bbf
Partial-Bug: #1590808

subject: api/httpd: stop nova-api service after package install
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 19:35:00.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/api.pp'], 'message': 'api/httpd: stop nova-api service after package install

Ubuntu provides some packages that start services automatically. It
causes issues when you run services with Apache for example.

This patch sets this orchestration when httpd is enabled for nova-api on
Ubuntu:

* Make sure we stop nova-api after installing nova-api
* Make sure we stop nova-api before starting apache

Depends-On: I33e565638f39ace819645215912303d6e431870c
Change-Id: I946f955c7b10b1f028c912d1344ee33cbf44578e
'}]
commit_message:
api/httpd: stop nova-api service after package install

Ubuntu provides some packages that start services automatically. It
causes issues when you run services with Apache for example.

This patch sets this orchestration when httpd is enabled for nova-api on
Ubuntu:

* Make sure we stop nova-api after installing nova-api
* Make sure we stop nova-api before starting apache

Depends-On: I33e565638f39ace819645215912303d6e431870c
Change-Id: I946f955c7b10b1f028c912d1344ee33cbf44578e

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated port param in firewall rules

This has been removed by the puppet-firewall module in favor of
explicit dport and sport params.  I believe in every case we are
intending to set dport, so that's what this change does.

Change-Id: I35c9efca691f865f2e2562ee81a7195d48d27d7a

commit_message:
Add Zaqar installation guide

This patch adds Zaqar-specific contents of the OpenStack Installation
Guide in the Zaqar repository per [1]. It only covers installation on
Red Hat-based systems.

Also this patch adds tox.ini environment for install-guide and adds
openstackdocs-theme to test-requirements.txt.

The Zaqar Installation Guide structure is based on Install Guide
Cookiecutter: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314229/.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/newton/project-specific-installguides.html

Change-Id: I72300c146b22511da4432775fc84e8c821a3fd12
Implements: blueprint install-guide-in-tree
Partially-Implements: blueprint projectspecificinstallguides

commit_message:
Fix deprecated API usage of keystone client

* Use keystoneauth1 for making session, which is shared throw all clients
* KeystoneClient is now only wrapper over session
Requirements has been updated to meet global requirements for mitaka release:
1. Bumped clients versions
2. requests has blacklisted versions due to bugs

Closes-bug: #1571611

Change-Id: Icc59761b590b76a8d3ddac9b4f219efc097447a5

Create V9 version of catalog driver interface

In preparation for api changes for service provider filtering,
a V9 version of the catalog driver interface is created.

Co-Authored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Partially implements: bp service-provider-filters

Change-Id: Ic929c65134ebdc150ea994a036992332cf5adb9a

commit_message:
Add infra puppet gem dependency holder repo

This repo (actually a ruby gem) serves as one place to list puppet gem
dependencies. This avoids us having to make 60+ one line changes when we
need to bump or pin a gem.

No repo to import.

Change-Id: I2eaa81a06d061d4ef65a8b717961de446dce9c8a
Needed-By: I2dc35841b13b886753314a31adf0254590279451

commit_message:
Fix and improve the partition coordinator

* Fix the partition coordinator to distribute tasks properly.

* Improve the partition coordination mechanism in retry logic, exception
  handling, and log messages, etc. Refer to the Ceilometer's changes:

- Icf60381e30f3baf986cf9e008e133287765d9827
- I6a48cf38b24a00a0db94d3dea0c6746b52526026
- Ic0b6b62dace88e4e1ce7932024350bb211efb9ef
- I8100160a3aa83a190c4110e6e8be9b26aef8fd1c
- I2aed2241ded798464089b3eec5e1394422a45844

Closes-Bug: #1575530
Change-Id: I5729ae3080898e8a6d92889f8c520174dc371113
(cherry picked from commit dd06bf9277774c56121be0b4878c8973f38e761d)
(cherry picked from commit 966f7692abda7896e1389ee6c8e030f0e37dce0f)

subject: Two-phase Instance deployment support
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 17:33:21.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/Instance.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/two-phase-instance-deploy-81d37e7987abc792.yaml'], 'message': "Two-phase Instance deployment support

Currently the provisioning of VM Instances is done by calls of the
'deploy' method of 'io.murano.resources.Instance' class. This method
generates the snippet of Heat template describing the VM and its
resources, merges this snippet into the global template of the
environment and then pushes this template to Heat API.

Thus the provisioning of N instances can currently be done only with N
updates of the Heat stack, i.e. with N calls of the Heat API, each
followed by a significant wait interval.
The proper way to do this would be to generate a single Snippet for
all the VMs at once, then execute a single Heat Stack update - and then
process its output also for all the VMs at once.

To allow application developers to implement such a behavior, the
'deploy' method of Instance class is split into two parts:
generation of the heat template snippet and the actual pushing of the
snippet into the Heat API.
These two phases are implemented as 'beginDeploy' and 'endDeploy'
methods of the Instance class. These methods are supposed to be
properly called by the application code willing to provision multiple
instances at once, while the old 'deploy' method just calls them
sequentially and is left for backwards compatibility.

Similar approach is implemented for releaseResources routine.

Change-Id: I985883816bbe9dcc23b05a4170d22acd4af9222d
Targets-blueprint: scalable-application-framework
"}]
commit_message:
Two-phase Instance deployment support

Currently the provisioning of VM Instances is done by calls of the
'deploy' method of 'io.murano.resources.Instance' class. This method
generates the snippet of Heat template describing the VM and its
resources, merges this snippet into the global template of the
environment and then pushes this template to Heat API.

Thus the provisioning of N instances can currently be done only with N
updates of the Heat stack, i.e. with N calls of the Heat API, each
followed by a significant wait interval.
The proper way to do this would be to generate a single Snippet for
all the VMs at once, then execute a single Heat Stack update - and then
process its output also for all the VMs at once.

To allow application developers to implement such a behavior, the
'deploy' method of Instance class is split into two parts:
generation of the heat template snippet and the actual pushing of the
snippet into the Heat API.
These two phases are implemented as 'beginDeploy' and 'endDeploy'
methods of the Instance class. These methods are supposed to be
properly called by the application code willing to provision multiple
instances at once, while the old 'deploy' method just calls them
sequentially and is left for backwards compatibility.

Similar approach is implemented for releaseResources routine.

Change-Id: I985883816bbe9dcc23b05a4170d22acd4af9222d
Targets-blueprint: scalable-application-framework

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 18:08:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_cloudbyte.py'], 'message': "Use cinders test class in cloudbyte unit tests

The cloudbyte unit tests were inheritting directly from
testtols so they weren't getting all the goodness from
the default fixutre setup, most noticeably the logging
setup.  The result was a bunch of noise generated in
the unit test output.

This changes the base class for the cloudbyte unit tests
to pull in cinder.tests instead of testtools directly,
which fixes up the noise.

There are a still a number of places where cloudbyte is
accessing testtools directly, which may or may not be ok.

Change-Id: Ic4cfdc99ba17f0999a382db96020aa583b876020
Closes-Bug: #1593808
"}]
commit_message:
Use cinders test class in cloudbyte unit tests

The cloudbyte unit tests were inheritting directly from
testtols so they weren't getting all the goodness from
the default fixutre setup, most noticeably the logging
setup.  The result was a bunch of noise generated in
the unit test output.

This changes the base class for the cloudbyte unit tests
to pull in cinder.tests instead of testtools directly,
which fixes up the noise.

There are a still a number of places where cloudbyte is
accessing testtools directly, which may or may not be ok.

Change-Id: Ic4cfdc99ba17f0999a382db96020aa583b876020
Closes-Bug: #1593808

subject: Catch DriverLoadFailure + Correct concurrency of gabbi >1.22.0 + remove most oslo.context usage + remove dependency on sphinxcontrib-docbookrestapi
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-17 15:24:42.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/messaging.py', 'aodh/api/controllers/v2/alarms.py', 'aodh/tests/unit/test_notifier.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'aodh/rpc.py', '.testr.conf', 'aodh/evaluator/__init__.py', 'aodh/tests/evaluator/test_threshold.py', 'aodh/tests/functional/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Catch DriverLoadFailure + Correct concurrency of gabbi >1.22.0 + remove most oslo.context usage + remove dependency on sphinxcontrib-docbookrestapi

new oslo.messaging 5.2.0 release will raise
oslo_messaging.transport.DriverLoadFailure if no existent transport
driver, hence breaks our code and unit test as well.

This patch fixes it by adding DriverLoadFailure to catch list.

Closes-Bug: #1588151
(cherry picked from commit 9c5df8400b621141db93a259900efe3702eb6241)

+

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

(cherry picked from commit 86e94d9ab2b46080cd570194f2f8257da6e1ea9b)

+

The RequestContextSerializer of oslo.messaging has been deprecated, and
actually we don't need it. Let's drop it and remove the oslo.context
usage in most use cases.

This fix the stable/liberty tests since oslo.context added a new field recently
that broke the tests.

(cherry picked from commit 3c08a6e58672d0c2b9f5ddedf53795351836082f)

+

This Sphinx extension is no longer used nor maintained and can be safely
removed.

(cherry picked from commit 3b6a3bfab3f021d4a3aca312753a8935c7e96b31)

Change-Id: I318d4b93beac9d1816fe4b5f9eb9de98e4debc04
"}]
commit_message:
Catch DriverLoadFailure + Correct concurrency of gabbi >1.22.0 + remove most oslo.context usage + remove dependency on sphinxcontrib-docbookrestapi

new oslo.messaging 5.2.0 release will raise
oslo_messaging.transport.DriverLoadFailure if no existent transport
driver, hence breaks our code and unit test as well.

This patch fixes it by adding DriverLoadFailure to catch list.

Closes-Bug: #1588151
(cherry picked from commit 9c5df8400b621141db93a259900efe3702eb6241)

+

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

(cherry picked from commit 86e94d9ab2b46080cd570194f2f8257da6e1ea9b)

+

The RequestContextSerializer of oslo.messaging has been deprecated, and
actually we don't need it. Let's drop it and remove the oslo.context
usage in most use cases.

This fix the stable/liberty tests since oslo.context added a new field recently
that broke the tests.

(cherry picked from commit 3c08a6e58672d0c2b9f5ddedf53795351836082f)

+

This Sphinx extension is no longer used nor maintained and can be safely
removed.

(cherry picked from commit 3b6a3bfab3f021d4a3aca312753a8935c7e96b31)

Change-Id: I318d4b93beac9d1816fe4b5f9eb9de98e4debc04

commit_message:
Add docstring validation

This introduces a linter for PEP257 to avoid trivial nitpicking of
docstrings in code reviews. Because flake8_docstrings simply provides a
plugin to add pep257 to flake8, you can run it via `tox -e pep8`.

PEP257 checks which we are currently violating are ignored in tox.ini.
We can remove them from the ignored list as they are fixed.

Change-Id: I01ebad7b70cf61dd80d3c06c6808d8178fbdd634
Related-Bug: 1501544
Depends-On: I60adf0dca4aa32f4ef6bca61250b375c8a3703c6

commit_message:
Modify the manual-devstack document for copying api-paste.ini

Magnum-api needs the api-paste.ini which in /etc/magnum/, also
remove the redundant Keystone admin_user and admin_password,since
they are not in the magnum.conf.sample.

Change-Id: I79414036190159999b8bd2a3d4fc3ebf6d551c45

commit_message:
Allow output to default to stdout using argparse

The argparse module already has the capability to default to stdout
at CLI parameter definition time. This patch utilizes this and avoids
the opening of the output file by each formatter.

Change-Id: Ib1e89492558fe1fc06966711b6014bd5b86b84c8

commit_message:
Update networking-ovn project functionality

The networking-ovn project no longer provides a monolithic
plugin. It has switched to an ML2 mechanism driver with a
Layer 3 service plugin.

commit_message:
Allow libvirt plugin to output disk metrics less often

A user has requested that disk metrics from the libvirt plugin be output
less often than the default collection period because they are not as crucial
and are a large part of the metrics output by the libvirt plugin.

Add an optional configuration period, disk_collection_period, which can be set
as the minimum period to output disk metrics

Change-Id: I43d84c4c18da3bc7f477c627e61433ca68ba2e4b

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-04-09 00:18:16.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py', 'tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'swiftclient/utils.py', 'swiftclient/service.py', 'doc/manpages/swift.1'], 'message': "Add --decode-content option

Previously we would automatically decode objects with a gzip
content-encoding on download, then promptly raise an error because the
md5 of this downloaded file didn't match the object's etag. In addition,
as a user the expectation should be that whatever bytes were uploaded
should be the exact same bytes that will be downloaded. As a result, we
no longer decode object data (see related change).

Some clients, however, may have viewed that decoding as a feature rather
than a bug, and simply ignored the errors that were occurring. This
patch adds a new parser option (--decode-content) to return to the
previous behavior sans error.

Change-Id: I70076140f96088136173781257484253aacb4567
Related Change: I6cc30a5c12e37de06d7322533a3c36ad15397cc8
"}]
commit_message:
Add --decode-content option

Previously we would automatically decode objects with a gzip
content-encoding on download, then promptly raise an error because the
md5 of this downloaded file didn't match the object's etag. In addition,
as a user the expectation should be that whatever bytes were uploaded
should be the exact same bytes that will be downloaded. As a result, we
no longer decode object data (see related change).

Some clients, however, may have viewed that decoding as a feature rather
than a bug, and simply ignored the errors that were occurring. This
patch adds a new parser option (--decode-content) to return to the
previous behavior sans error.

Change-Id: I70076140f96088136173781257484253aacb4567
Related Change: I6cc30a5c12e37de06d7322533a3c36ad15397cc8

An Inventory.capacity property has been added to validate that
Inventory.total and Inventory.reserved do not conflict. This will

commit_message:
Add delete_, update_ and add_ inventory to ResourceProvider

Each of these reuses the methods used by set_inventory for
deleting, updating or adding just one Inventory to a
ResourceProvider.

With the addition of these methods, the existing set_inventory
needs a clarifying docstring.

An Inventory.capacity property has been added to validate that
Inventory.total and Inventory.reserved do not conflict. This will
also eventually be used to make comparisons with Usages.

The version of the ResourceProvider object does not require a
version bump, despite the change in object hash, because
ResourceProviders are not yet being used in the wild.

Partially Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I62836faf829b93997a176aba4e0dc3502ae54049

commit_message:
Fix db purge for volume_types FK constraint

db purge command raises FK constraint while purging volume_types
and volume_type_projects deleted rows.
Delete volume_type_projects records before deleting volume_types
to solve this issue.

Change-Id: I46d3c7559c58e979e6227825ed0b2e21158415c2
Closes-Bug: #1589806

to run tests. There was only one class that inherited TestAuth and that was

commit_message:
Remove TestAuth

All token tests that describe the behavior of the token API have been
consolidated into the TokenAPITests class. This means that TestAuth is empty
and is no longer needed. This commit removes it and classes that inherited it
to run tests. There was only one class that inherited TestAuth and that was
TestAuthFernetTokenProvider. This class has also been removed since
TestFernetTokenAPIs exists and tests everything in the TokenAPITests.

All future tests that enhance or modify the behavior of token should be done
using TokenAPITests.

Change-Id: I1234aaffec6bea35e42e7d7367c397736498acfc

commit_message:
Move last few TestAuth tests to TokenAPITests

This commit move the last of the tests from TestAuth to TokenAPITests. The
TestAuth class is now empty but everything it was testing now living in
TokenAPITests, which is tested with more token providers.

A subsequent patch will remove TestAuth.

Change-Id: I59dc990a46bc2f99ff55efb9f3aa9a1ede07edc3

commit_message:
Move external auth and bind test to TokenAPITests

This commit continues to move token behavior tests to a single class,
TokenAPITests. It also removes a TODO to run some tests using PKI because the
TokenAPITests class is already run with PKI enabled. The TestAuth class didn't
do this.

Change-Id: Ie9646753f7cb8d6925de3e0b4ab03818a9d67d76

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-09 16:35:43.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/runners/user_actions_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/backup_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/__init__.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/instance_delete_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/database_actions_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/module_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/cluster_actions_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/instance_actions_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/helpers/postgresql_helper.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/guest_log_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/test_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/replication_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/instance_create_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/root_actions_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/backup_group.py', 'trove/tests/int_tests.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/configuration_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/user_actions_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/instance_create_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/replication_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/module_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/database_actions_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/configuration_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/instance_delete_runners.py'], 'message': 'Reorganize scenario test order to speed up run

This changeset stitches together all the different groups
in a way to have 3 instances being created at any given
time (where possible).  The groupings will be:

-- module
|- configuration
-- instance_actions

-- database_actions
|- backup
-- instance_actions

-- user_actions
|- root_actions
-- guest_log

-- replication

Times (on a fast test machine) went from 2230s to 1720s, an
improvement of 23%.

The group labels were moved into the __init__.py file to facilitate
being accessed by different group implementations (to avoid a
circular import issue).

Tests were also cleaned up and homogenized wherever possible.

Change-Id: Ia0b43db1ff0696d361f4cb21fb455cccc7d61f3f
Closes-Bug: #1571092
'}]
commit_message:
Reorganize scenario test order to speed up run

This changeset stitches together all the different groups
in a way to have 3 instances being created at any given
time (where possible).  The groupings will be:

-- module
|- configuration
-- instance_actions

-- database_actions
|- backup
-- instance_actions

-- user_actions
|- root_actions
-- guest_log

-- replication

Times (on a fast test machine) went from 2230s to 1720s, an
improvement of 23%.

The group labels were moved into the __init__.py file to facilitate
being accessed by different group implementations (to avoid a
circular import issue).

Tests were also cleaned up and homogenized wherever possible.

Change-Id: Ia0b43db1ff0696d361f4cb21fb455cccc7d61f3f
Closes-Bug: #1571092

subject: Fixed inability to deploy if security groups are disabled
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7226, 'name': 'Stan Lagun', 'email': 'stan.lagun@gmail.com', 'username': 'istalker2'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 13149, 'name': 'Dmytro Dovbii', 'email': 'dmanddov@gmail.com', 'username': 'Ddovbii'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}, {'_account_id': 20773, 'name': 'Valerii Kovalchuk', 'email': 'kovvalole@gmail.com', 'username': 'vakovalchuk'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-20 09:30:42.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/no-neutron-sec-group-support-2d69082b7226d6c0.yaml', 'meta/io.murano/manifest.yaml', 'murano/engine/system/net_explorer.py', 'meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NeutronNetworkBase.yaml', 'meta/io.murano/Classes/system/DummySecurityGroupManager.yaml'], 'message': "Fixed inability to deploy if security groups are disabled

Existing implementation of Neutron-based networking assumed that the
neutron's security groups are used to manage VM accessibility.
However there may exist environments with disabled security-group
extension in Neutron and thus relying on something else to restrict
the traffic. Murano could not operate in such environments since it
always was attempting to create resources of type
OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup and attach VMs' ports to this resource.

This is addressed by introducing a new subclass of
SecurityGroupManager - DummySecurityGroupManager, which actually does
nothing but silently ignores the calls to create security rules. This
new security manager is instantiated instead of
NeutronSecurityGroupManager for Neutron-based networks in cases if the
'security-group' extension is not present in Neutron's configuration.
If it is instantiated a warning message is reported to the end-user to
notify them that security requirements of the application were
ignored.

Change-Id: Ia3bc6c17f9ca0a4b8bf8c272481760a8c81b27b7
Closes-bug: #1593253
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed inability to deploy if security groups are disabled

Existing implementation of Neutron-based networking assumed that the
neutron's security groups are used to manage VM accessibility.
However there may exist environments with disabled security-group
extension in Neutron and thus relying on something else to restrict
the traffic. Murano could not operate in such environments since it
always was attempting to create resources of type
OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup and attach VMs' ports to this resource.

This is addressed by introducing a new subclass of
SecurityGroupManager - DummySecurityGroupManager, which actually does
nothing but silently ignores the calls to create security rules. This
new security manager is instantiated instead of
NeutronSecurityGroupManager for Neutron-based networks in cases if the
'security-group' extension is not present in Neutron's configuration.
If it is instantiated a warning message is reported to the end-user to
notify them that security requirements of the application were
ignored.

Change-Id: Ia3bc6c17f9ca0a4b8bf8c272481760a8c81b27b7
Closes-bug: #1593253

commit_message:
ABC Metaclass for IBM FlashSystem

This patch introduces ABC metaclass into IBM FlashSystem driver.

In this patch,
* Add ABC metaclass for IBM FlashSystem FC and iSCSI driver.
* Bump version to 1.0.11.

Change-Id: Ib3f8f0563008c487951fed8532e205b2be3f5032
Implements: blueprint ibm-flashsystem-abc

commit_message:
Allow setting CG name or description to empty value

This change allow API user to remove the consistency group name
or description information.
If user use the `cinder consisgroup-update consisgroup-id --name ''`
or `cinder consisgroup-update consisgroup-id --description ''`
to update the consisgroup's name or description information,
the consisgroup's name or description information will be removed.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I0d661775994d6de580f8788397f0e91e90148edd
Closes-Bug: #1572986

The following changes have been made to reorganize the structure of this
role's test playbooks, bringing them into line with other
OpenStack-Ansible roles:
  - move each playbook to an individual file
  - rename playbooks descriptively
  - define hosts and groups directly in the inventory file
  - include group vars required by containers
  - store extra variables in a single shared test-vars file
  - remove use of the openstack_hosts role
  - include callback plugin for human readable logging of test tasks

Change-Id: I4829e368003f58685cb96b7ee743255d00542187
(cherry picked from commit a37735c3fb4be98d7bcb531946ae903ae62fdb36)

commit_message:
Reorganize test playbooks

The following changes have been made to reorganize the structure of this
role's test playbooks, bringing them into line with other
OpenStack-Ansible roles:
  - move each playbook to an individual file
  - rename playbooks descriptively
  - define hosts and groups directly in the inventory file
  - include group vars required by containers
  - store extra variables in a single shared test-vars file
  - remove use of the openstack_hosts role
  - include callback plugin for human readable logging of test tasks

Change-Id: I4829e368003f58685cb96b7ee743255d00542187
(cherry picked from commit a37735c3fb4be98d7bcb531946ae903ae62fdb36)

commit_message:
Add "--network-segment" option to "subnet create"

Add "--network-segment" option to the "subnet create" command.
This is a beta command option and subject to change. Use global
option "--os-beta-command" to enable this option.

This patch set also provides a devref update for beta command
options.

Change-Id: I4d0fbe079b2a873307364c41c22ce9ba88e632e6
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Image type should be a facet

Glance images can either be of type Image or of type Snapshot.
This is determined with the image_type property. This property
is ONLY set if the image is of type snapshot.

However, there is no facet for image_type which makes filtering
in the UI harder.

To make it consistent, Searchlight will insert a value('image')
in 'image_type' field for base images.
For images based on snapshot glance provides 'snapshot' as value

Change-Id: Ib4d73b12d82229a2bb85434f665d734b171557b7
Closes-Bug: #1569485

commit_message:
Relocates cli options registration from bootstrap to server

This fixes an issue (see rhbz#1333884) where using the tempest
CLI results in the error 'Could not load 'zaqar_tests':
arguments already parsed: cannot register CLI option'. Moving the
cli options registration to cmd.server resolves this problem.

Change-Id: I56779da783261c6eba07a7d9286d1615dcff3598

commit_message:
Restrict access to Kibana for admin

This commit fixes access to Kibana via
KibanaProxyView. Otherwise Kibana
is accessible for non-admin users by typing
kibana adress directly into browser even if
button to open it up would be hidden.

Change-Id: I39d3ffc20de6e2e092cc604a25ef6b32ef016b4a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-19 06:54:21.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add sympy to requirements

SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics.
It is used by the Vitrage project for template parsing.
Sympy is depended upon mpmath add it only to upper-constraints

- Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes.
  here: https://github.com/sympy/sympy

- Is the library good code?
  Yes.
  It is stable and runs tests on the different actions it performs.
  We use it in Vitrage project.
  Vitrage: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Vitrage

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?
  Yes, BSD.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?
  Yes.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?
  No.

Change-Id: Ic2558b3e13810e9787f3dd21f323f20a8adec798
'}]
commit_message:
Add sympy to requirements

SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics.
It is used by the Vitrage project for template parsing.
Sympy is depended upon mpmath add it only to upper-constraints

- Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes.
  here: https://github.com/sympy/sympy

- Is the library good code?
  Yes.
  It is stable and runs tests on the different actions it performs.
  We use it in Vitrage project.
  Vitrage: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Vitrage

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?
  Yes, BSD.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?
  Yes.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?
  No.

Change-Id: Ic2558b3e13810e9787f3dd21f323f20a8adec798

All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

Change-Id: I3fe7b6b7f81a0b20888b2c70a717065e4b43674f

commit_message:
Make identity v2 tenants_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes identity v2 tenant_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I3fe7b6b7f81a0b20888b2c70a717065e4b43674f

commit_message:
Add IPv6 support for the management network

This change introduces the ability to use IPv6 addressing for the
management network by passing the network-management-v6.yaml
environment file. It also adjusts the network-management.yaml
environment file to point to the right network config templates.

Change-Id: I7f797c49f03b2623a08e033bdf45772edff0f08f

commit_message:
Revert "Add index on trunk_id in the subports model"

It was pointed out after merge that the index is, in fact, redundant.

This reverts commit 6d8d00fea1021cb50087bebf051b7795cda1978d.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 13:11:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/extensions/test_dns_integration.py'], 'message': 'tests: clean up designate client session mock on test exit

This test was modifying the driver session method without making an
effort to restore the original value after the test case completion.
This resulted in two consequent tests that relied on the method that
were triggered in the same test thread, to trigger a failure for one of
them.

Changed the setup logic for the test class to use mock.patch(..).start()
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1593647
Change-Id: I08be90691b5417025c40c5a18308d820dc7a43d2
(cherry picked from commit 3703b31eea06d5055a7fc63cec7a24b2aaa1c563)
'}]
commit_message:
tests: clean up designate client session mock on test exit

This test was modifying the driver session method without making an
effort to restore the original value after the test case completion.
This resulted in two consequent tests that relied on the method that
were triggered in the same test thread, to trigger a failure for one of
them.

Changed the setup logic for the test class to use mock.patch(..).start()
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1593647
Change-Id: I08be90691b5417025c40c5a18308d820dc7a43d2
(cherry picked from commit 3703b31eea06d5055a7fc63cec7a24b2aaa1c563)

subject: Use upper-constraints in tox test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-03 01:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Use upper-constraints in tox test environments

Recently OpenStack introduced a mechanism to specify a constrained
"working set" of packages that are "guaranteed" to produce a working
OpenStack environment. This pinning of packages limits the more
broadly-defined requirements.txt which is managed by
global-requirements.

This patch modifies our tox test environment to use upper-constraints
and explictly removes those requirements from the "venv" tox
environment that is used by some commands in infra.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

This is due to Ia1be8f60265d9dab2639a05912b4b7c51f1d4033 not being on
the stable/mitaka branch

Change-Id: I84582370e139fc5812bc85ae5341f7f9c8b93ff5
Related-Bug: 1554791
(cherry picked from commit 315958aab8273cd2dbfdd617b173d5c063a88948)
'}]
commit_message:
Use upper-constraints in tox test environments

Recently OpenStack introduced a mechanism to specify a constrained
"working set" of packages that are "guaranteed" to produce a working
OpenStack environment. This pinning of packages limits the more
broadly-defined requirements.txt which is managed by
global-requirements.

This patch modifies our tox test environment to use upper-constraints
and explictly removes those requirements from the "venv" tox
environment that is used by some commands in infra.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

This is due to Ia1be8f60265d9dab2639a05912b4b7c51f1d4033 not being on
the stable/mitaka branch

Change-Id: I84582370e139fc5812bc85ae5341f7f9c8b93ff5
Related-Bug: 1554791
(cherry picked from commit 315958aab8273cd2dbfdd617b173d5c063a88948)

The revert resize action's documentation appears to have been copied
from the documentation for confirm resize, and missed replacing the
word 'confirm' with 'revert' in one case. This fixes that.

It also gives incorrect information about the states involved through
the revert process. This also corrects that.

Closes-Bug: #1593295
"}]
commit_message:
fix errors in revert resize api docs

The revert resize action's documentation appears to have been copied
from the documentation for confirm resize, and missed replacing the
word 'confirm' with 'revert' in one case. This fixes that.

It also gives incorrect information about the states involved through
the revert process. This also corrects that.

Change-Id: Ib2436da238a4a7b71454ecfee81ede4054b3018e
Closes-Bug: #1593295

commit_message:
Support IP lookup of target portal DNS name

Oracle ZFSSA iSCSI driver will resolve the DNS name to an IP
address if a DNS name is supplied in place of an IP address for
the zfssa_target_portal property.

Change-Id: Ia059a9555af7e658fae32fbe60ceca33f657bb0a
Implements: blueprint oracle-zfssa-target-portal-dns-lookup

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-10 03:56:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_common.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vmax.py'], 'message': 'EMC driver should return ceiling of volume size

The function manage_existing_object_get_size returns the floor of
volume size in emc driver.For example, if the volume is less than
1024MB, the return size would be 0G. This patch fixes it by returning
the ceiling of volume size, just like LVM driver.

Change-Id: Id3a1aa4ecfdfff6c36114c93c75b33872a5645ea
Closes-Bug: #1586305
'}]
commit_message:
EMC driver should return ceiling of volume size

The function manage_existing_object_get_size returns the floor of
volume size in emc driver.For example, if the volume is less than
1024MB, the return size would be 0G. This patch fixes it by returning
the ceiling of volume size, just like LVM driver.

Change-Id: Id3a1aa4ecfdfff6c36114c93c75b33872a5645ea
Closes-Bug: #1586305

commit_message:
Tear down of os-disk-config part 2

This removes the portions of the os-disk-config extension that handles
additional attributes being passed in during
create/update/resize/rebuild. These are folded directly into
servers.py with a new module wide function for translating REST in =>
attr dict data structures.

Tests which use disk_config as the example for loading and using these
extensions are removed.

As this is the only in tree extension that hooks the resize entry
point, that is fully removed from setup.cfg and well as any extension
manager processing.

Part of bp:api-no-more-extensions

Change-Id: I691a3a917a3dbaa86072d689e9ebf42ba356ca60

rules. Rules should be defined and returned from a module in

commit_message:
Policy-in-code servers rules

This adds the basic framework for registering and using default policy
rules. Rules should be defined and returned from a module in
nova/policies/, and then added to the list in nova/policies/__init__.py.

A new context.can() method has been added for policy enforcement of
registered rules. It has the same parameters as the enforce() method
currently being used.

To establish the full pattern for usage the policy checks in the servers
API module have been registered and converted to the new usage.

Now that some policy checks are registered they're being used properly
by tests. Some tests have been updated so that the instance project_id
matches the context project_id in order to pass the 'admin_or_owner'
check.

Change-Id: I71b3d1233255125cb280a000b990329f5b03fdfd
Partially-Implements: bp policy-in-code

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I3e640481c23e0796eaf3cff4a53b387475a1d611
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Increase default overcloud deployment timeout

'minimal' deployments have begun to fail with the existing, 60 minute,
default time. Bumping to prevent build failures

- Increase default timeout to 75 minutes
- Remove timeout override for HA

commit_message:
[Docker] Do not try to delete container on destroyed host

When Environment get deleted both Docker/k8s host and
Docker applications get deleted. So it is possible that host
will try to delete container from an Instance that was already
destroyed. Attempt to send commands to such instance
will hang until timeout because there is no more agent
exist on the other side.

Change-Id: Ia6e8064ae50c24ce595ed08e446ed45b96b4a330
Closes-Bug: #1504623
Depends-On: I298f3f079a153ef87ed7213b7f1432c9e5e4b4b6
(cherry picked from commit dcf1f0672f2b1e1f70e4d8a93505ed084e7e9b65)

commit_message:
Make Barbican client respect OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE

See bug for details; this uses base.py's get_url() function to fetch
the appropriate URL.  Also sets the region.

subject: Properly set POLICY_FILES_PATH on RHEL
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 15:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['spec/horizon_spec.rb', 'templates/default/local_settings.py.erb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'spec/horizon-redhat_spec.rb'], 'message': "Properly set POLICY_FILES_PATH on RHEL

RHEL puts the POLICY_FILES_PATH in a different location than Debian so we need
to ensure we set it. For Ubuntu/Debian, we'll explictly set the path they
currently use. Without this set properly, horizon fails to load up on RHEL.

Change-Id: If4f75ef8a3094154b2aecf435746f7a2050d5699
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>
"}]
commit_message:
Properly set POLICY_FILES_PATH on RHEL

RHEL puts the POLICY_FILES_PATH in a different location than Debian so we need
to ensure we set it. For Ubuntu/Debian, we'll explictly set the path they
currently use. Without this set properly, horizon fails to load up on RHEL.

Change-Id: If4f75ef8a3094154b2aecf435746f7a2050d5699
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

commit_message:
initial refactoring step and addition of gnocchi

* applied new template logic and refactored all recipes accordingly
* removed vmware and suse support and specs
* removed alarm ceilometer-alarm notifier and evaluator (needs to be rewritten
  for aodh)
* added recipe for telemetry-metric/gnocchi deployment
* set gnocchi as default dispatcher for ceilometer
* added initial specs for gnocchi recipes

Depends-On: I22114b6d2d46cce561a2f292b92ff5f531cff533
Change-Id: If513cb2715d8266845bd6541d12005edef70f11c

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 15:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['puppet-openstack_spec_helper.gemspec'], 'message': "Unpin google-api-client

We used to pin google-api-client because Ubuntu Trusty didn't have Ruby
2.x but now we're running jobs on Xenial, we don't need to ping
google-api-client anymore, since we have Ruby 2.x on both centos7 &
xenial jobs.

Change-Id: Ib43b69611410bf43863a987f4c67a65c5dbd91c5
"}]
commit_message:
Unpin google-api-client

We used to pin google-api-client because Ubuntu Trusty didn't have Ruby
2.x but now we're running jobs on Xenial, we don't need to ping
google-api-client anymore, since we have Ruby 2.x on both centos7 &
xenial jobs.

Change-Id: Ib43b69611410bf43863a987f4c67a65c5dbd91c5

subject: Make fix_auth_url_version() delegate emitting the warning up the stack
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-16 17:47:02.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/tests.py', 'openstack_auth/views.py', 'openstack_auth/backend.py', 'openstack_auth/utils.py'], 'message': 'Make fix_auth_url_version() delegate emitting the warning up the stack

This makes sense because usually only the caller of
fix_auth_url_version() has enough context to decide what warning
message should be emitted (where did the wrong url come from? service
catalog or openstack_dashboard/settings.py?). This also will help to
reduce the number of redundant warnings, emitting them only when user
logs in or a value from service catalog was fixed.

The necessity of this change became obvious after discussion in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323786 comments.

Also a small refactoring was made to fix_auth_url_version() (which
previously was edited in haste) - to reuse existing helper functions,
this makes the code a bit cleaner.

Needed-By: I6c6a35b1c460e22dadf39634fce1bdfa257b8c63
Change-Id: I3a04d838a707465c8c6e81e0e6e2fcf918b7b059
'}]
commit_message:
Make fix_auth_url_version() delegate emitting the warning up the stack

This makes sense because usually only the caller of
fix_auth_url_version() has enough context to decide what warning
message should be emitted (where did the wrong url come from? service
catalog or openstack_dashboard/settings.py?). This also will help to
reduce the number of redundant warnings, emitting them only when user
logs in or a value from service catalog was fixed.

The necessity of this change became obvious after discussion in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323786 comments.

Also a small refactoring was made to fix_auth_url_version() (which
previously was edited in haste) - to reuse existing helper functions,
this makes the code a bit cleaner.

Needed-By: I6c6a35b1c460e22dadf39634fce1bdfa257b8c63
Change-Id: I3a04d838a707465c8c6e81e0e6e2fcf918b7b059

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-01 14:59:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_db_api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_actions.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Minimize cost of DB exists decorator checks

We have 2 DB decorators, require_volume_exists and
require_snapshot_exists, that rely on retrieving the resource from the
DB to make sure that it really exists, but we don't really need to
retrieve the data from the DB and build the ORM model from the data in
order to decide if the resource exists.

This patch modifies both decorators to use a more efficient method using
EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM ... WHERE ...) which not only reduces the amount of
data retrieved from the DB but also removes the parsing of the data into
the resource's ORM model.

Change-Id: I90dec6dda5b2c91b78c1257afdb1b749f4bdc030
"}]
commit_message:
Minimize cost of DB exists decorator checks

We have 2 DB decorators, require_volume_exists and
require_snapshot_exists, that rely on retrieving the resource from the
DB to make sure that it really exists, but we don't really need to
retrieve the data from the DB and build the ORM model from the data in
order to decide if the resource exists.

This patch modifies both decorators to use a more efficient method using
EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM ... WHERE ...) which not only reduces the amount of
data retrieved from the DB but also removes the parsing of the data into
the resource's ORM model.

Change-Id: I90dec6dda5b2c91b78c1257afdb1b749f4bdc030

commit_message:
requirements: upgrade to latest pyroute2

Pyroute2 had a bug with older kernels such as 3.16 that was being
exposed in kuryr fullstack tests when ran in the ubuntu jenkins slaves:

    https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/259

The bug was patched in:

    https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/commit/22a2a06c0

The 0.4.3 pyroute2 release includes it and solves the issues

Change-Id: I2a49099777b392c63861b2bde9a30b7dbf4938e5
Signed-off-by: Antoni S. Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

subject: Generating 400 error for binary payload with plan/text accept header
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-07 18:44:24.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/secret_store.py'], 'message': "Generating 400 error for binary payload with plan/text accept header

Currently barbican server is returning 500 (Internal server) generic
error when get secret payload call is requested with 'text/plain'
accept header for a secret which is stored as applicaiton/octet-stream
content-type. Barbicans server already does the validation for this kind
of case but still returns generic error. Its more appropriate to return
client input error (400 error) as client needs to provide expected
content-type for reading the payload.

Change-Id: I49d72daa4babb68f74f6443f32182f7e0d7e05ab
Closes-Bug: #1590097
"}]
commit_message:
Generating 400 error for binary payload with plan/text accept header

Currently barbican server is returning 500 (Internal server) generic
error when get secret payload call is requested with 'text/plain'
accept header for a secret which is stored as applicaiton/octet-stream
content-type. Barbicans server already does the validation for this kind
of case but still returns generic error. Its more appropriate to return
client input error (400 error) as client needs to provide expected
content-type for reading the payload.

Change-Id: I49d72daa4babb68f74f6443f32182f7e0d7e05ab
Closes-Bug: #1590097

commit_message:
Drop ec2 from list of enabled API's

ec2 is not needed on compute nodes (nova-api just provides metadata
to instances on the local compute node), so drop from list of
enabled API's.

It's also dropped in later OpenStack releases.

Change-Id: I52de3a8118af4828c146c92e140b58a0288744d7

subject: Add link to Project Creator's Guide
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-20 10:39:44.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/preface.rst'], 'message': "Add link to Project Creator's Guide

It is quite easy for a newcomer who wants to create a new project
to mistakenly arrive at the Project Team Guide first before discovering
the Project Creator's Guide.  This is in part because:

  - the Project Team Guide is listed on http://docs.openstack.org/ above
    the link to the Infrastructure Documentation
    (http://docs.openstack.org/infra/),

  - the Infrastructure Manual is linked from within
    http://docs.openstack.org/infra/, so it's one extra hop away, and
    consequently

  - it is not immediately obvious from http://docs.openstack.org/ that
    the Infrastructure Documentation contains any info on project
    creation.

However even if it is practical to address these without compromising
other aspects of the design of the navigation around these front pages,
it would still be possible for newcomers to make the same mistake, e.g.
by following links from elsewhere.

This leads to reviews such as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324798/.

Therefore make it clear at the top of the Project Team Guide that if you
don't already have a project created, you should go to the Creator's
Guide first.

Change-Id: I33c5d7ca110e0c2110e5fa6589cb4b953edafc0a
Signed-off-by: Adam Spiers <aspiers@suse.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add link to Project Creator's Guide

It is quite easy for a newcomer who wants to create a new project
to mistakenly arrive at the Project Team Guide first before discovering
the Project Creator's Guide.  This is in part because:

  - the Project Team Guide is listed on http://docs.openstack.org/ above
    the link to the Infrastructure Documentation
    (http://docs.openstack.org/infra/),

  - the Infrastructure Manual is linked from within
    http://docs.openstack.org/infra/, so it's one extra hop away, and
    consequently

  - it is not immediately obvious from http://docs.openstack.org/ that
    the Infrastructure Documentation contains any info on project
    creation.

However even if it is practical to address these without compromising
other aspects of the design of the navigation around these front pages,
it would still be possible for newcomers to make the same mistake, e.g.
by following links from elsewhere.

This leads to reviews such as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324798/.

Therefore make it clear at the top of the Project Team Guide that if you
don't already have a project created, you should go to the Creator's
Guide first.

Change-Id: I33c5d7ca110e0c2110e5fa6589cb4b953edafc0a
Signed-off-by: Adam Spiers <aspiers@suse.com>

commit_message:
Remove extra expected error code (413) from image metadata

Out of quota error has been changed from 413 to 403 in
I7c179748769b8a0e2cc2e476ebefe33449f6f304, but those
remained in expected error code in image metadata APIs.

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: Id49c34750931508fb96251a4e1b3d1d8612f7f0d

commit_message:
Refactor test_validate_v2_scoped_token_with_v3_api

This commit moves the test_validate_v2_scoped_token_with_v3_api test from the
TestAuth module to the TokenAPITests module. It also renames the test to
accurately reflect what it is doing. Lastly, it removes a utility method,
get_v2_token() because it was no longer in use in TestAuth.

Change-Id: I95a19b2413740ac0c7e21636dd7f2f0dbbd00d69

subject: Remove test_validate_v2_unscoped_token_with_v3_api
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 13:39:18.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py'], 'message': "Remove test_validate_v2_unscoped_token_with_v3_api

This test actually creates a token against v2.0 and then uses that token to
create a new token against v3. It doesn't validate the token at all. I've
improved the naming of this test and consolidated it with others that already
test similar behavior - TokenAPITests.test_v2_v3_unscoped_token_intermix(). In
I95a19b2413740ac0c7e21636dd7f2f0dbbd00d69 the test is renamed to more
accurately describe what it's actually doing.

Change-Id: I91aba771804469b4241e2f92437eb869ffe4a964
"}]
commit_message:
Remove test_validate_v2_unscoped_token_with_v3_api

This test actually creates a token against v2.0 and then uses that token to
create a new token against v3. It doesn't validate the token at all. I've
improved the naming of this test and consolidated it with others that already
test similar behavior - TokenAPITests.test_v2_v3_unscoped_token_intermix(). In
I95a19b2413740ac0c7e21636dd7f2f0dbbd00d69 the test is renamed to more
accurately describe what it's actually doing.

Change-Id: I91aba771804469b4241e2f92437eb869ffe4a964

Using the keystoneauth1 library makes auth_utils much simpler,
also removes the hardcoded 'Default' domain and the strange mix of
the usage of v2.0 and v3 options.

commit_message:
set up jobs to publish our release tools to pypi

We have a few situations where jobs in one repo need the tools in
another. We've started installing them via zuul-cloner, but it would be
simpler to just release them and install the package.

Change-Id: Ic40ca3b83c20ace5c208aab7df92ff431d968c31
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 20084, 'name': 'Intel networking-odl CI', 'email': 'intel-odl-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-odl-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-17 19:42:33.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Default LOG_COLOR based on interactive execution

Change I4a10a49db97d413349bcfceeb8c4164936fbcc40 added colorful PS4 via
tput.  However, if TERM is not set (as is the case when stacking
noninteractively), tput errors with the following:

tput: No value for $TERM and no -T specified

...twice for every log message, thus flooding the logs.

This change set turns LOG_COLOR off by default for noninteractive
execution.  If LOG_COLOR is set to True when noninteractive (TERM is
unset), obviate the above errors by passing tput a simple -T.

Change-Id: I0f8ad82375cde463160bad5bd9918f1e4b19326d
Closes-Bug: 1576405
'}]
commit_message:
Default LOG_COLOR based on interactive execution

Change I4a10a49db97d413349bcfceeb8c4164936fbcc40 added colorful PS4 via
tput.  However, if TERM is not set (as is the case when stacking
noninteractively), tput errors with the following:

tput: No value for $TERM and no -T specified

...twice for every log message, thus flooding the logs.

This change set turns LOG_COLOR off by default for noninteractive
execution.  If LOG_COLOR is set to True when noninteractive (TERM is
unset), obviate the above errors by passing tput a simple -T.

Change-Id: I0f8ad82375cde463160bad5bd9918f1e4b19326d
Closes-Bug: 1576405

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-15 15:34:06.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Replace vif_portgroup_id with vif_port_id

Ironic portgroup is associated with a neutron vif port during nova
pluging vif process, and save the port id to it's extra field, per
nova portgroup patch, we use vif_port_id for portgroup like port,
which is inconsistent and there's no need to add a new vif_portgroup_id

Change-Id: Ie9021f60b781515ec1a0d218cbd6af7e87920747
Closes-Bug: #1588669
"}]
commit_message:
Replace vif_portgroup_id with vif_port_id

Ironic portgroup is associated with a neutron vif port during nova
pluging vif process, and save the port id to it's extra field, per
nova portgroup patch, we use vif_port_id for portgroup like port,
which is inconsistent and there's no need to add a new vif_portgroup_id
to bring more complexity, as it just use to track the neutron port.

Change-Id: Ie9021f60b781515ec1a0d218cbd6af7e87920747
Closes-Bug: #1588669

commit_message:
Remove admin role name 'admin' hardcode

Because of hardcoding name as the 'admin' was impossible to
use administrative panel with a custom administrative role name.
This fix replaces hardcoding the name of the administrative role
with RBAC policy check.

DocImpact
Related commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123745/
Change-Id: I05c8fc750c56f6f6bb49a435662e821eb0d6ba30
Closes-Bug: #1161144
(cherry picked from commit ce5fb26bf5f431f0cdaa6860a732338db868a8fb)
