subject: Add a response schema for "log" attribute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 19:11:53.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/instance_usage_audit_logs.py'], 'message': 'Add a response schema for "log" attribute

During the nova reivew of Ic1a307c405f769cadd037ae45e921d88b6a2bea5 ,
we found the lack of the response schema for "log" attribute.
The "log" attribute should have state, instances, errors and message
according to https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/instance_usage_audit_log.py#L104

Then this patch adds them to the response schema.

Change-Id: I1c0fab7ba54cc346e9f9f2308c8a46f5ee00b9d6
'}]
commit_message:
Add a response schema for "log" attribute

During the nova reivew of Ic1a307c405f769cadd037ae45e921d88b6a2bea5 ,
we found the lack of the response schema for "log" attribute.
The "log" attribute should have state, instances, errors and message
according to https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/instance_usage_audit_log.py#L104

Then this patch adds them to the response schema.

Change-Id: I1c0fab7ba54cc346e9f9f2308c8a46f5ee00b9d6

commit_message:
zuul/layout: fix rule for beaker-xenial jobs

Puppet beakers jobs on Xenial should not be run on stable/mitaka, we
probably missed it when we added the job in the gate.
This patch fix it.

Also ignore xenial-nv jobs on stable branches.

Change-Id: I14ce562f1a870b75633eb7f052ddace484e00e4f

commit_message:
Ability to add and remove subscriptions

This patch adds the ability to add subscriptions WITHOUT options.
Future patch will add options and form validation.
Future patch will add ability to update subscriptions.

Co-Authored-By: Thai Tran <tqtran@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Cusatis <dcusati@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I752e0cf25bb1da7200819760ee56880b32132246

subject: Standardize logger usage
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-20 15:16:53.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/agent.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server_group.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v2_0/user.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/project.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/federation_protocol.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/identity_provider.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/service.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/role.py', 'openstackclient/common/extension.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/user.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v2_0/role.py', 'openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_service.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/flavor.py', 'openstackclient/image/v1/image.py', 'openstackclient/network/v2/port.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v2_0/project.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v2_0/service.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server_image.py', 'openstackclient/common/availability_zone.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/group.py', 'openstackclient/network/v2/address_scope.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/mapping.py', 'openstackclient/network/common.py', 'openstackclient/image/v2/image.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/domain.py'], 'message': "Standardize logger usage

Use file logger for all command specific logs.

This patch also fixes some usage that doesn't
follow rules in:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

After this patch, all self.log and self.app.log
will be standardized to LOG().

NOTE: In shell.py, we got the log in class OpenStackShell,
      which is also known as self.app.log in other classes.
      This logger is used to record non-command-specific logs.
      So we leave it as-is.

Change-Id: I114f73ee6c7e84593d71e724bc1ad00d343c1896
Implements: blueprint log-usage
"}]
commit_message:
Standardize logger usage

Use file logger for all command specific logs.

This patch also fixes some usage that doesn't
follow rules in:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

After this patch, all self.log and self.app.log
will be standardized to LOG().

NOTE: In shell.py, we got the log in class OpenStackShell,
      which is also known as self.app.log in other classes.
      This logger is used to record non-command-specific logs.
      So we leave it as-is.

Change-Id: I114f73ee6c7e84593d71e724bc1ad00d343c1896
Implements: blueprint log-usage

revisions:

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with

"}]
commit_message:
Removes the use of mutables as default args

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, 'arg = [] if arg is None else arg'.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I384b24e81543999a8b873e3223cd409ed799ffa0

Set parameters to true to activate.
Default True Paramters: vm_cpu_check_enable, vm_disks_check_enable,
vm_network_check_enable, vm_ping_check_enable

Change-Id: I6fb8d86e62fb3f7f73295a107a79c595fde3dffc

commit_message:
Add parameters to configure libvirt checks.

Adds ability to control which metrics are stored in the libvirt plugin.
Set parameters to true to activate.
Default True Paramters: vm_cpu_check_enable, vm_disks_check_enable,
vm_network_check_enable, vm_ping_check_enable
Default False Parameters: vm_extended_disks_checks_enable

Change-Id: I6fb8d86e62fb3f7f73295a107a79c595fde3dffc

commit_message:
Add angular defaults panel for admin

Adding a new panel to admin dashboard that will use angular js
instead of the django templates for the defaults.

Set DISABLED = False in
openstack_dashboard/enabled/_2121_admin_defaults.py

Co-Authored-By: Kristine Brown<kbrown@thoughtworks.com>
Change-Id: Icaa5e54f5e3e8f93cee8d331d4c98ff103755b52
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-defaults-panel

commit_message:
Vagrant to use local branch for devstack

By default devstack was cloning master when setting up devstack.
This change has the devstack plugin clone the local working branch so
that uncommitted changes can be tested.

Change-Id: If963ea1d703cd9d4d96665e75db08834cf473b33

commit_message:
Removed spark-events from config

Allow spark to configure the location of spark-events.
Add spark events log config to spark-defaults in devstack plugin.
Move spark events logging to /var/log/spark/events for devstack plugin.
Set group permissions to ensure spark events log directory is group, but not
world writable.

Change-Id: I26aef23a9a801a02a20e14899e1c89b10556e4d4

subject: Trivial documentation change to trigger publish job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-14 19:38:26.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst'], 'message': "Trivial documentation change to trigger publish job

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323961/ has merged but docs
won't publish to http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron-dynamic-routing/
until at least one change merges into the repo in order to trigger
Jenkins/Zuul to run the publish job. Right now there is no change in Gerrit
that looks ready to merge immediately so I have made a trivial correction
(capitalizing the acronym API) in order to trigger the docs publishing.

Change-Id: I3cc8097210a86e08b6250d7d3f69d1cd4c24e974
"}]
commit_message:
Trivial documentation change to trigger publish job

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323961/ has merged but docs
won't publish to http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron-dynamic-routing/
until at least one change merges into the repo in order to trigger
Jenkins/Zuul to run the publish job. Right now there is no change in Gerrit
that looks ready to merge immediately so I have made a trivial correction
(capitalizing the acronym API) in order to trigger the docs publishing.

Change-Id: I3cc8097210a86e08b6250d7d3f69d1cd4c24e974

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-14 09:15:41.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/rpc/receiver.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_rpc_consumer.py'], 'message': "Handle exception when comparing of MACs fails in check_dhcp_resp

In case MAC's value is empty string comparing utils.is_same_mac fails
with ValueError exception which may leads to responses from other nodes not
being processed. We need to properly handle such situation.

commit_message:
Handle exception when comparing of MACs fails in check_dhcp_resp

In case MAC's value is empty string comparing utils.is_same_mac fails
with ValueError exception which may leads to responses from other nodes not
being processed. We need to properly handle such situation.

Change-Id: I8843f9eabd139222ac326fdc26a43f5702ba751b
Related-Bug: #1569339
Related-Bug: #1569325

commit_message:
Move UpdateDnsmasq task to network manager extension

This change introduces a new callback on_nodegroup_delete
which is called when a nodegroup is deleted.

It also adds a decorator that can be used to generate
before and after callbacks for any method.

Change-Id: Ia1c4ef3956175af6c223af854c9543cd781e8dbf
Blueprint: network-manager-extension

commit_message:
Change SecretAcceptNotSupportedException from exception.BarbicanException to exception.BarbicanHTTPException

When retrieving secret's payload without providing payload_content_type,
if the payload_content_type is not default as "text/plain", we get 500 error.
Since this is generated by invalid input, we should mark this as 406 error.

Closes-bug: #1590097
Change-Id: I9ca94b7c66995991a9b0df37a46bd082e9795b74

commit_message:
Consider status of check_dhcp for each node

DHCP check task may fail on particular node from given set. In this case
data for that node will contain information about status of the
operation and particular causes of the error (if supplied by dhcp
checker itself). In such situation the task must be set to error status
despite results from other nodes.

Change-Id: I7dddbf727c31264596e5de6e169b09b2c0cfe20e
Closes-Bug: #1569339

Full and incremental backup and restore strategy for postgres
based on pg_basebackup and WAL shipping.

Full backups are effectively data directory filesystem snapshots
aided by the use of the pg_basebackup tool. Incremental backups
are performed by creating recovery points and backing up the
appropriate WAL files since the previous backup. Restore is
done by recreating the data directory based on a pg_basebackup
snapshot and copying the needed WAL files for
incremental recovery.

A new scenario test group for incremental backups was also added.
(Note that parts of the new test have already been refactored in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324060 )

Change-Id: I60d52d8cdf7744976c2cae0ea1aca2fd8d07e902
'}]
commit_message:
Postgresql Incremental Backup and Restore

Full and incremental backup and restore strategy for postgres
based on pg_basebackup and WAL shipping.

Full backups are effectively data directory filesystem snapshots
aided by the use of the pg_basebackup tool. Incremental backups
are performed by creating recovery points and backing up the
appropriate WAL files since the previous backup. Restore is
done by recreating the data directory based on a pg_basebackup
snapshot and copying the needed WAL files for
incremental recovery.

A new scenario test group for incremental backups was also added.
(Note that parts of the new test have already been refactored in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324060 )

Implements: bp/pgsql-incremental-backup
Change-Id: I60d52d8cdf7744976c2cae0ea1aca2fd8d07e902

commit_message:
Human friendly message for invalid hostname

Unfortuanately json schema validators don't allow specifying more human
friendly message as an alternative to complex regex patterns. So, the
only way is to perform hostname validation "manually".

Change-Id: Iee1717a3034fe4e33569fbeff6553b5bc949605e
Closes-Bug: #1567875

on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Iefa2770f3aadd34da76542f092d946b491de7ed5

subject: Finish porting unit tests to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 14:32:54.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/db/migration/test_migrations.py', 'murano/tests/unit/api/cmd/test_test_runner.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Finish porting unit tests to Python 3

Port the last unit tests to Python 3, test_test_runner:

* TestCaseShell constructor: don't replace sys.stdout and sys.stderr
  by StringIO, it's useless and prevent using print() to debug
  failing unit tests.
* shell(): use mock.patch() to replace sys.stdout and sys.stderr
* test_version(): on Python 3, the version is written into stdout,
  not stderr.
* test_package_is_not_provided(): the exact error message changes on
  Python 3.

test_migrations:

* Use a byte string for archive and logo BLOBs

Remove whitelist of tests running on Python 3 from tox.ini since all
unit tests now pass on Python 3!

Blueprint: murano-python-3-support
Change-Id: Ic795b99526746ac0c06427001e4da27275b76d84
"}]
commit_message:
Finish porting unit tests to Python 3

Port the last unit tests to Python 3, test_test_runner:

* TestCaseShell constructor: don't replace sys.stdout and sys.stderr
  by StringIO, it's useless and prevent using print() to debug
  failing unit tests.
* shell(): use mock.patch() to replace sys.stdout and sys.stderr
* test_version(): on Python 3, the version is written into stdout,
  not stderr.
* test_package_is_not_provided(): the exact error message changes on
  Python 3.

test_migrations:

* Use a byte string for archive and logo BLOBs

Remove whitelist of tests running on Python 3 from tox.ini since all
unit tests now pass on Python 3!

Blueprint: murano-python-3-support
Change-Id: Ic795b99526746ac0c06427001e4da27275b76d84

ML2 had a bug that makes it incompatible with deferred IP allocation.
This patch is now rebased on top of the fix for that bug and so this

commit_message:
Make segment aware IPAM compatible with ML2

The segment aware IPAM unit tests run under a stripped down plugin
using only the most generic common code.  However, in testing in other
environments, I've found a couple of incompatibilities with ML2.

ML2 had a bug that makes it incompatible with deferred IP allocation.
This patch is now rebased on top of the fix for that bug and so this
patch adds new unit tests that prove compatibility with ML2 (mostly
running all the unit tests under ML2 in addition to the strip down
plugin).  It also contains a fix for a host binding issue found by
adding these new unit tests.

Change-Id: I73ad280e35a9d9c121474a7c7b85cd027864ab21
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Override get_object() and get_objects() for Trunk

This patch enables proper joining of subports to trunks in the OVO
model. Reading of Trunk objects will include attach the proper
attachment of associated subports.

Change-Id: I87be475bfc17c4e075a6a791fb7b22d639a4d60d
Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

commit_message:
WIP Invoke Django actions from Angular

This patch explores how Angular can load, display and execute
actions that are currently locked away as Django actions on
a particular table. For example:
openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.networks.ports.tables.CreatePort

Change-Id: Idd95213cae0aa9faa0c067cc5d5532c518559cf0

commit_message:
Extend YAQL context through Nailgun extensions

It would be very convenient (but not necessary) to extend YAQL context
(i.e. set of helper functions) via Nailgun extensions. That might be
very helpful if end users build their own custom deployments on top of
Fuel.

Change-Id: Ib47d8204ff995517fc9a4d7889de8bbc9c23f227

commit_message:
Add existed network failed if the gateway already created

This patch check if the port is gateway in ipam_request_address,
if the port is gateway, kuryr check if the request gateway is
same with gateway in existed network.

Change-Id: I3e4926339b028483745763267fdc7821ddcf4659
Closes-Bug: #1584286
Closes-Bug: #1582107

commit_message:
Update ironic-multitenant network vairable names

Community decided to change variables name during development.
This patch updates names for job variables:
IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_DRIVERS --> IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES
IRONIC_NETWORK_DRIVER --> IRONIC_NETWORK_INTERFACE

Change-Id: I030742d24b38a6ceef57df8b0ac9909bb971d6dd

commit_message:
trove-integration should use zuul user

Now that Jenkins has been retired in favour of pure Zuul, we should
remove references to the jenkins user in the trove-integration scripts.
See this notice for more details:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/097595.html

Change-Id: Ie4a995392464fd31576a1d0da6ad003d1c5f7fab
Closes-Bug: #1593771

commit_message:
Promote existing OSA non-voting Xenial tests to voting

After a few weeks of testing as non-voting jobs, OpenStack-Ansible
roles which have had non-voting jobs are being promoted to voting.

The pip_lock_down role is deliberately left out as it is scheduled
for retirement within this cycle and will not require Xenial
support.

Change-Id: Ia884f90d0d48578bbce81d2b48db47fee3b9098d

commit_message:
Do not run any grenade jobs on mitaka and older branches

Right now the regex is ^gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic$, but the grenade
itself is with -nv suffix now. Let's not run both voting and
non-voting grenade jobs.

Change-Id: I5391475d363b1b0e0a5c1b3bd2d7596e5c645092

subject: Fix console url show command broken in microversion case
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 13:14:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_console.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/console.py'], 'message': 'Fix console url show command broken in microversion case

The response data of nova get_xxx_console API is changed
from "console" to "remote_console" in microversion 2.6, and nova
server side API schema verify the spice vnc type to "spice-html5",
update OSC code to apply these change so that OSC can work in
different nova microversion cases.

Change-Id: I3bb4fe057e656209d00d2bb308ac3f7f837cb03f
Closes-Bug: #1590318
'}]
commit_message:
Fix console url show command broken in microversion case

The response data of nova get_xxx_console API is changed
from "console" to "remote_console" in microversion 2.6, and nova
server side API schema verify the spice vnc type to "spice-html5",
update OSC code to apply these change so that OSC can work in
different nova microversion cases.

Change-Id: I3bb4fe057e656209d00d2bb308ac3f7f837cb03f
Closes-Bug: #1590318

commit_message:
[networking] minor fixes

adv-cfg-address-scope.rst:
* subnetpool-update is the correct command name
* Improves the description on subnets on an external network

adv-cfg-subnet-pools.rst:
* Fix a string with a single quote which has no meaning
* Fix the term: subnet -> subnet pool
* Use :option: directive for command line options

Change-Id: Ie894392e59d9e2b42f8f31df74876f949a234b09
(cherry picked from commit 4a7bdf8e041dad34dae5d71a1e39c3544667406a)

In module netaddr valid_ipv4 raise exception AddrFormatError
if address is specified as empty string. Method is_valid_ipv4
catches the exception and returns boolean value. So we'd better
use it from oslo.utils.

Change-Id: I452d437692e44f4e20ff1b064032d247c0ab7530
"}]
commit_message:
Use is_valid_ipv4 from oslo.utils

In module netaddr valid_ipv4 raise exception AddrFormatError
if address is specified as empty string. Method is_valid_ipv4
catches the exception and returns boolean value. So we'd better
use it from oslo.utils.

Change-Id: I452d437692e44f4e20ff1b064032d247c0ab7530

subject: Fixes race condition in HeatStack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 13:09:01.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/system/heat_stack.py'], 'message': 'Fixes race condition in HeatStack

Before each operation HeatStack waits for the stack to become available.
But if several operations happen concurrently it might be the case when
several threads both check stack availability and conclude its ready and
then both try to update it. In this case Heat client throws HTTPConflict
exception. This fix handles it and retries the operation after delay.

Change-Id: Ibff461ed606e7fb1fc76ad422b4431476e22ab0b
Closes-Bug: #1571863
(cherry picked from commit 9536e51fa07fdc53c8d0b734367c3fc9ac300dbc)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes race condition in HeatStack

Before each operation HeatStack waits for the stack to become available.
But if several operations happen concurrently it might be the case when
several threads both check stack availability and conclude its ready and
then both try to update it. In this case Heat client throws HTTPConflict
exception. This fix handles it and retries the operation after delay.

Change-Id: Ibff461ed606e7fb1fc76ad422b4431476e22ab0b
Closes-Bug: #1571863
(cherry picked from commit 9536e51fa07fdc53c8d0b734367c3fc9ac300dbc)

subject: Update the PHYP vSwitch for Neutron Agents
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-20 13:03:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vif.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vif.py', 'nova_powervm/conf/powervm.py'], 'message': "Update the PHYP vSwitch for Neutron Agents

There is a PHYP virtual switch that is used when the PowerVM Nova driver
is paired with the Neutron Open vSwitch or Linux Bridge agent.
Initially this was named 'OpenStackOVS', but this change set renames it
to the 'NovaLinkVEABridge' to bring it more in line with its general
purpose nature.

Change-Id: Ib4521f2286ba7963c3a40303f6013c4b5a6522f7
"}]
commit_message:
Update the PHYP vSwitch for Neutron Agents

There is a PHYP virtual switch that is used when the PowerVM Nova driver
is paired with the Neutron Open vSwitch or Linux Bridge agent.
Initially this was named 'OpenStackOVS', but this change set renames it
to the 'NovaLinkVEABridge' to bring it more in line with its general
purpose nature.

Change-Id: Ib4521f2286ba7963c3a40303f6013c4b5a6522f7

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 09:30:18.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/utils/logs.py'], 'message': "fix race with syslog while renaming remote log dir

When a node gets new name nailgun renmaes log directoty
which had name in for mof <IP> to <node name> and then
creates symlink <IP> -> <node name>. The problem is that
node is still active and this moment and sends some logs
to syslog on master node.

So when we renamed <IP> to <node name> and haven't created
symlink name syslog may find missing log dir and it creates
it again in this case. Then nailgun tries to create symlink
and fails.

To avoid this situation we can suspend rsyslog temporarity.
It's better to do it with SIGSTOP/SIGCONT, because process
exist in this case and remote logs will be held in kernel
tcp or odp buffers until we wake up rsyslog and it process
new messages. Fortunately centos-7 uses journald together
with rsyslog, so local logs (send by syslog function) are
handled by journald and rsyslog just get it from journald
files. So it's safe to stop rsyslog temporarily, nothing
will be droppped.

Change-Id: Icb1ed6669be2f7b448c465de33de37e0b945fb79
Closes-Bug: #1506112
(cherry picked from commit 019ad234af0f8344102d3342587312a7ec5256fa)
"}]
commit_message:
fix race with syslog while renaming remote log dir

When a node gets new name nailgun renmaes log directoty
which had name in for mof <IP> to <node name> and then
creates symlink <IP> -> <node name>. The problem is that
node is still active and this moment and sends some logs
to syslog on master node.

So when we renamed <IP> to <node name> and haven't created
symlink name syslog may find missing log dir and it creates
it again in this case. Then nailgun tries to create symlink
and fails.

To avoid this situation we can suspend rsyslog temporarity.
It's better to do it with SIGSTOP/SIGCONT, because process
exist in this case and remote logs will be held in kernel
tcp or odp buffers until we wake up rsyslog and it process
new messages. Fortunately centos-7 uses journald together
with rsyslog, so local logs (send by syslog function) are
handled by journald and rsyslog just get it from journald
files. So it's safe to stop rsyslog temporarily, nothing
will be droppped.

Change-Id: Icb1ed6669be2f7b448c465de33de37e0b945fb79
Closes-Bug: #1506112
(cherry picked from commit 019ad234af0f8344102d3342587312a7ec5256fa)

commit_message:
Fix trust notifier

The keystone methods to get a client with a trust is broken, and simply
use service credentials while ignoring the trust. We can't load the
options directly from the configuration, we need to build a auth plugin
manually.

Change-Id: Ic5edb144eac3a4b30b9835bf251f25f65b8c29b5

commit_message:
Exclude networks with no subnets angular

Nova doesnt allow to boot from a network which has
no subnet, so we should not show those networks on the
new instance launch angular panel.
On the python launch instance this was solved in patch
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/commit/1b6807baf385d6e5768f149fa8e4d07bc24ebff1

Change-Id: I8b94d45e95f8e22b579d04f6cec7345d947f8e12
Closes-Bug: #1237711

commit_message:
Release oslo.privsep 1.9.0

Highlights:

Adds an (optional for now) initialisation function that should be called
near top of main() in applications that use oslo.privsep.

In particular, this allows applications to tell privsep which rootwrap
executable to use, removing the need to set helper_command in
oslo.config in many cases.

Change-Id: I8bb782a848e44d7c00affdc921c4f2d8afa9b114
Depends-On: I3ea73e16b07a870629e7d69e897f2524d7068ae8
Partial-Bug: #1592043

commit_message:
Add '--dep-exists-action' argument to murano CLI

It allows to apply different default actions for existing main
package and existing dependencies. In case of specifying just
'--exists-action', action for dependencies equals to that like it
was previously.
Unit tests to check new functionality are added.

Change-Id: I7b5d3b5b40b7bceae7afc407b64ecd8da77443e7
Closes-bug: #1582631

commit_message:
Add new configuration option to turn postcopy on/off

Since QEMU 2.5 and Libvirt 1.3.3 it is possible to use postcopy
live migration to ensure an upper limit in the amount of memory
to be transferred duing the live migration process. This option
enables to live migrate instances with memory-intensive workloads
by driving the migration process by the destination host, i.e.,
after the switch to postcopy mode, the destination VM is the active
one and therefore any dirty pages are directly generated at the
destination hosts.

Change-Id: Ifef18a3408fda2ba4567312bedde405a0575fc27
Signed-off-by: Luis Tomas <luis5tb@gmail.com>

subject: Fetch class descendants in the dynamic_ui from glare
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-06 10:30:04.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/api/packages.py', 'releasenotes/notes/abstract-base-class-fix-7cb06a0924b973f3.yaml', 'muranodashboard/dynamic_ui/fields.py'], 'message': "Fetch class descendants in the dynamic_ui from glare

Before this change whenever a murano-class dependency was specified in
the ui definition of a package, only packages that contained those
specific fqns were fetched from API, even though the information about
inheritance is available in the glare back-end.

With this change dashboard also fetches all the packages, that have
classes, that inherit from the specified package. This change also
alters the way absence of a package is handled. It's now specified as an
empty field with explanation, rather then a django message. This allows
having only partial dependencies and skipping optional dependencies
altogether

Change-Id: I6632f72ca260c26a116b3aa4608d9592d0f1cbce
Closes-Bug: #1585812
"}]
commit_message:
Fetch class descendants in the dynamic_ui from glare

Before this change whenever a murano-class dependency was specified in
the ui definition of a package, only packages that contained those
specific fqns were fetched from API, even though the information about
inheritance is available in the glare back-end.

With this change dashboard also fetches all the packages, that have
classes, that inherit from the specified package. This change also
alters the way absence of a package is handled. It's now specified as an
empty field with explanation, rather then a django message. This allows
having only partial dependencies and skipping optional dependencies
altogether

Change-Id: I6632f72ca260c26a116b3aa4608d9592d0f1cbce
Closes-Bug: #1585812

* Replace len(MultiDict.keys()) with len(MultiDict). On Python 3,
  MultiDict.keys() now returns a generator which has no length.
* Replace json with jsonutils to fix Unicode vs bytes issues.
* Use a bytes strings for the HTTP body, not Unicode strings.
* Replace LOG.exception() with LOG.error() when the argument is a
  string, not an exception object.
* Only declare PackageException.__str__() on Python 2. The default
  implementation of __str__() is fine on Python 3. Moreover, the
  'message' attribute has been removed from Exception on Python 3.
* tox.ini: run the following API v1 unit tests on Python 3.4

  - test_actions
  - test_catalog
  - test_env_templates
  - test_environments
  - test_sessions

Blueprint: murano-python-3-support
Change-Id: I4c8bedef019495477ae668769595ac4abc1ac0f4
"}]
commit_message:
Port API v1 unit tests to Python 3

* Replace len(MultiDict.keys()) with len(MultiDict). On Python 3,
  MultiDict.keys() now returns a generator which has no length.
* Replace json with jsonutils to fix Unicode vs bytes issues.
* Use a bytes strings for the HTTP body, not Unicode strings.
* Replace LOG.exception() with LOG.error() when the argument is a
  string, not an exception object.
* Only declare PackageException.__str__() on Python 2. The default
  implementation of __str__() is fine on Python 3. Moreover, the
  'message' attribute has been removed from Exception on Python 3.
* tox.ini: run the following API v1 unit tests on Python 3.4

  - test_actions
  - test_catalog
  - test_env_templates
  - test_environments
  - test_sessions

Blueprint: murano-python-3-support
Change-Id: I4c8bedef019495477ae668769595ac4abc1ac0f4

commit_message:
AMQP 1.0 - create only one Cyrus SASL configuration for the tests

The Cyrus SASL library can only be initialized once per process. And
the configuration must remain available until all the tests have run.

Change-Id: I2810ecf53956fc5d4fcdc944f8e06237ca985e6a
Closes-Bug: #1591211

commit_message:
Follow symlinks when copying logs

There are symlinks in /etc/openvswitch, these cause failing log uploads
because the target will be unreadable.

Change-Id: I0c07b41161aa47e518d343196242e339fdf2281d

commit_message:
remove extra quota commit of manage snapshot

When manage an existing snapshot of a volume, cinder-api and cinder-vol
both commit quota. This result in an extra commit.This change remove
the extra commit in the cinder-api.

Closes-bug: #1562830
(cherry picked from commit 9809769707352e756575b02a4520248b18c8559b)

Change-Id: Iab1f14f61eff13c867f5bc6ebac74681504aa857

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Iebb7837721f08a4f7cf0657ede5e6822045608b2

One of the foundations for NFV enabled clouds is to have Networking
Service Function Chaining which provides an ability to define an ordered
list of network services which to form a “chain” of services.
This could be used by f.e. Telcos to simplify management of their

Implements blueprint: plugin-networking-sfc
Change-Id: I2fff8f01949a708e0251ad860fbd0a238c9e92fc
'}]
commit_message:
Support for Service Function Chaining in Murano

One of the foundations for NFV enabled clouds is to have Networking
Service Function Chaining which provides an ability to define an ordered
list of network services which to form a “chain” of services.
This could be used by f.e. Telcos to simplify management of their
infrastructure.

Implements blueprint: plugin-networking-sfc
Change-Id: I2fff8f01949a708e0251ad860fbd0a238c9e92fc

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I05d8199238727ebca25666196cf9060a94d3e7b8
